historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already >0.75 but is slightly fading alongside complexity decay, so I’ll stay near the best-record regime (U=0.10) while reducing decay terms (notably k_A_decay, which previously caused a big drop when mis-set at Gen 120) to flip dA/dt positive and stabilize C/A.

A is already far above 0.75 but all derivatives are negative, so I’ll largely revert/stay near the best-record settings (U=0.10) and make a small sustaining tweak by reducing k_A_decay slightly (past k_A_decay changes had the biggest impact) while easing D’s collapse by lowering k_D_decay a bit.

A is already far above the 0.75 objective but is slightly fading (dA/dt < 0), and past large changes to k_A_decay caused a big drop (Gen 120.1), so I’ll keep U at the best-record value and make a very small reduction in k_A_decay to stabilize A without destabilizing C/D.

A is already >0.75 but is slowly fading (dA/dt<0) alongside decaying C, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while taking a calculated stabilizing step by lowering k_A_decay slightly (past tweaks to k_A_decay sometimes helped and we want to arrest the drift without disrupting high D).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=+0.0015) while current U/params match the best record, so I’ll keep U steady and make a small stabilizing tweak to counter the slight complexity decay without risking a destabilizing phase shift (noting past k_A_decay changes sometimes harmed A).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0), but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt<0), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while reducing diversity decay pressure (lower k_D_decay) and slightly boosting intrinsic diversity replenishment (k_D_growth) to stabilize D without destabilizing A (history shows large k_A_decay moves can be risky).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0116) largely from overly strong quadratic decay (k_D_decay=0.10 vs best 0.03), so I’ll keep U at the best-record value (0.10) while reverting k_D_decay toward the best to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already maxed but has a small negative drift while Diversity is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.009), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and slightly reduce diversity decay (k_D_decay) plus agency decay (k_A_decay) to stabilize A without adding selection pressure (per history, k_D_decay tweaks have been safe and k_A_decay changes can swing A).

Agency is already above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0) while complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level and reduce k_A_decay (which historically produced the biggest A gains) plus slightly reduce k_C_decay to stabilize C and sustain A’s upward trajectory.

Agency is already above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt=0.0030), so to preserve the winning configuration near the best-record U=0.10 while accelerating A further, I’ll keep U steady and reduce the unusually high k_A_decay (currently 0.100 vs best-record 0.005) to prevent unnecessary agency loss (noting past k_A_decay tweaks were high-impact, including the big drop at Gen 744.7).

name: Liminal Decay Tactician
description: This agent emerged by tuning its “leak rates” (k_A_decay, k_C_decay, k_D_decay) into a narrow stability corridor, repeatedly finding that reduced decay reliably lifted Agency while overly aggressive tweaks caused collapses. With very high coupling from difficulty into agency (k_AU=0.99) but operating in a low-difficulty niche (U=0.10), it converts even mild environmental pressure into decisive action, maintaining strong Diversity (0.944) and solid Complexity (0.830) without triggering validation violations.
